intro: Tephrosia argyrolampra, commonly known as silverleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom during the wet season. Tephrosia argyrolampra is often found in open woodlands and savannas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
